p: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is a single stranded RNA, enveloped, beta coronavirus characterised by spikes protruding from the surface [ 4]. Normally found in mammals, birds, and reptiles, this strain has not previously been identified in humans [ 5]. Previous strains of coronavirus outbreaks in humans include Middle East Respiratory Syndrome (MERS) in 2012 and Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) in 2003 [ 5, 6].
